page.title: 01GENERAL INFORMATION
page.content: The block lies on a north west facing escarpment of the chalk ridge which forms a north easterly extension of the Chiltern Hills. The highest point in the SE corner of the block is about 137 m. above sea level. About 2 sq. km. in the North West of the block is occupied by the town of Baldock. The only other settlement is the village of Clothall in the SE corner of the block. The area is administered by North Herts District Council, and Hertfordshire County Council and is divided between the parishes of Clothall, Weston and Baldock. The principle communication links are the A1(M), the A505 (Luton to Royston) and the A507 (Baldock to Buntingford). The Cambridge to Kings Cross railway line serves Baldock, but outside the area of the block.
